contentrichtext.text: {{USBL team | color1 = red | color2 = black | color3 = white | logo = Oklahoma storm logo.png | pixels = 150px | founded = 1999 | founder = James Sears Bryant | league = [[United States Basketball League|USBL]] 1999-2007 | history = Oklahoma Storm<br>1999-present | arena = [[Mark Price Arena]] | city = [[Enid, Oklahoma|Enid]], [[Oklahoma]] | colors = Red, Black, & White | owner = [[Oklahoma Storm, LLC]] | coach = [[Roy Rogers (basketball)|Roy Rogers]] | championships = 1 2002 | titles = ? | cheerleaders = | dancers = | mascot = }} [[Image:Oklahoma Storm.png|thumb|left|100px|Former logo]] The '''Oklahoma Storm''' was a [[United States Basketball League]] team located in [[Enid, Oklahoma]]. Founded by [[sports agent]] and [[Lawyer|attorney]] James Sears Bryant, the Storm successfully captured the USBL championship under head coach [[Kareem Abdul-Jabbar]] in 2002, defeating Kansas with a final score of 122-109.<ref>"Abdul-Jabbar Wins USBL Championship As Coach Of Oklahoma Storm; Leaves Team" ''Jet'', Jul 22, 2002, page 51</ref> The team played its home games at [[Mark Price Arena]] and the [[Chisholm Trail Expo Center]]. The Oklahoma Storm disbanded following the 2007 season when the USBL dissolved.<ref>[[USBL]]</ref> Several Storm players, including [[Willie Burton]], [[LaBradford Smith]], [[Richard Dumas]], [[Gaylon Nickerson]], [[Brent Price]], [[James Lang]], [[Chris Porter]], [[Reggie Slater]], [[Ira Newble]], [[Bubba Wells]], [[Kelly McCarty]], [[Tony Bobbitt]] and [[Jamario Moon]], played for the [[NBA]], either prior to or after playing for the Storm. ==References== <references/> == External links == *[http://www.usbl.com/ USBL League Website] {{United States Basketball League}} {{Oklahoma Sports}} [[Category:Sports in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma]] [[Category:United States Basketball League teams]] [[Category:Basketball teams in Oklahoma]] [[Category:Enid, Oklahoma]] {{Oklahoma-stub}} {{US-basketball-team-stub}}
